thread.title: US Judge grants injunction against Trump's 'Muslim-ban' in Virginia | World | News | Express.co.uk
thread.title_full: US Judge grants injunction against Trump's 'Muslim-ban' in Virginia | World | News | Express.co.uk

author: Aletha Adu
title: US Judge grants injunction against Trump's 'Muslim-ban' in Virginia | World | News | Express.co.uk
text:
BREAKING: US Judge grants injunction to STOP Trump's 'Muslim-ban' affecting Virginia BREAKING: US Judge grants injunction to STOP Trump's 'Muslim-ban' affecting Virginia PRESIDENT Trump’s hopes of fulfilling his pledge of banning refugees from seven Muslim-majority countries coming to the US has faced yet another legal setback, as a Judge issued a preliminary injunction on the ban to stop it affecting the state of Virginia. PUBLISHED: 05:12, Tue, Feb 14, 2017 | UPDATED: 05:29, Tue, Feb 14, 2017 GETTY Donald Trump's travel ban is facing further legal issues 
US District Judge Leonie Brinkema ruled the travel ban was found on an unconstitutional religious bias, which violates the First Amendment prohibitions on favouring one region over another. 
In her 22-page ruling, Judge Brinkema said Trump's promises during the campaign to implement what came to be known as a "Muslim ban" provide evidence the current executive order unconstitutionally targets Muslims, according to ABC news. Related articles Donald Trump pledges to work closely with Canada 
She added: “The president himself acknowledged the conceptual link between a Muslim ban and the EO (executive order).” 
Virginia Attorney General Mark Herring, a Democrat who brought the lawsuit against Trump in Virginia, hailed the judge’s ruling. 
Mr Herring told ABC news: “Judge Brinkema's ruling gets right to the heart of our First Amendment ... claim.” 
Initially, Mr Herring had asked the Judge to enforce the injunction nationwide, but Brinkema refused stating the nationwide suspension of the ban, implemented from Washington, would cover the other areas. 
Virginia based its plea for an injunction on the basis that the ban would negatively affect the state. UK Reacts To Trump's 'Muslim' Travel Ban Mon, January 30, 2017 President Trump signed an executive order banning immigration to the USA from seven 'muslim' countries. This led to protests across America and, now, the UK.
